subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: When Writing Saved a Religion
description: One-minute skill: When Writing Saved a Religion.

hook.text: Judaism survived exile, destruction, and diaspora. How? It became a religion of the book. The Torah was portable.

buildup.text: When the Temple was destroyed in 70 CE, Judaism could have died. But the Torah contained everything needed to continue.

discovery.text: Religions with written scriptures survive disasters better. The book replaces the temple, the priest, and the land.

twist.text: Oral religions like Druidism vanished when disrupted. Written religions rebuild from their texts. Writing is armor.

climax.text: The printing press, then the internet, made scriptures even more durable. Technology is religion's best survival tool.

punchline.text: The Torah made Judaism portable. Writing is a religion's best survival tool.

quiz.question: Why do religions with written scriptures survive better?
options: Texts preserve teachings when temples and priests are lost
